body:
I had a similar implementation when I first had a go at this wrapper. I think the reason @ebrevdo asked me to keep the inputs as `None` was to keep the behavior of `one_hot()` outputting a tensor of the same type as `on_value` and `off_value` (without having to re-specify it in `dtype`) . This led to all of the case checking below.

Personally, I think what you've suggested works well- it makes sense for `dtype` to act as a toggle switch rather than a type-checking device. It definitely makes the wrapper more readable too :D
